definition: lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
vomit
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to drip/to strain or filter/a trickle
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]

sentences.english: He had written the book with great pains.
sentences.chinese: 他呕心沥血写了这本书。

sentences.english: I have bled for this magazine.
sentences.chinese: 我为这个杂志呕心沥血。

sentences.english: Every day, he worked his heart out in the gardens.
sentences.chinese: 每天都会在花园里辛勤劳作，呕心沥血。

sentences.english: Mr Li always selects exercises for us.
sentences.chinese: 李老师总是呕心沥血地为我们精选习题。

sentences.english: Millions of Chinese have worked for years to this end.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的中国人呕心沥血多年，就是为了这一天。

sentences.english: He worked indefatigably to train cadres in modern military science.
sentences.chinese: 为造就具有现代军事科学知识的干部，伯承呕心沥血。

definition: to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
heart's blood/expenditure (for some project)/meticulous care
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
to make nothing of hardships
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
hardworking/industrious
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to spare no effort
diligently
all one's life/lifetime
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3
